$50,000 Kent Stakes

$50,000 Irish Day Stakes

Corgi Races

SOPHOMORES IN SPOTLIGHT THIS WEEK AT EMERALD DOWNS

Sophomores take center stage as Emerald Downs moves into Week 10 of the 50-day meeting. Sunday’s card features 3-year-old colts and geldings in the $50,000 Irish Day Stakes at 6 1/2 furlongs and 3-year-old fillies in the $50,000 Kent Stakes at 6 1/2 furlongs. Auburn Stakes winner Top Executive and 2020 Horse of the Meeting Dutton headline 12 nominees to the Irish Day while Ms Lynn and Camden High, first and second at 17 to 1 and 21 to 1 in the Seattle Stakes, top 11 nominees to the Kent. Saturday’s twilight card features a pair of $24,750 allowance tests at one mile–one for older horses and one for older fillies and mares. Multiple stakes winner Daffodil Sweet (pictured) is 6 to 5 in the older fillies and mares race while multiple stakes winner Unmachable is 6 to 5 in the older horse test.

$50,000 Irish Day Stakes nominations, Sunday, July 18, 6 ½ Furlongs (3-year-old colts & geldings): Big Endeavor, Bobby Brinkley, Dutton, Float On, House of Lords, Juspassinthru, Kowboy Kabin, Nationheart, Naval Escort, Rings of Saturn, Slew’s Tiz, Whiz, Top Executive. Entries taken Wednesday, July 21

$50,000 Kent Stakes nominations, Sunday, July 16, 6 ½ Furlongs (3-year-old fillies): Bayakoas Image, Blazingbellablu, Broad Approval, Camden High, Coastal Run, Just Distorted, La Una, Ms Lynn, Only Danielle, Oreo’s Dream, Zippin Sevenz. Entries taken Wednesday, July 21

Claims Report

Claimed: 91

Aggregate: $508,750

Largest Claims:

1: $25,000, Gordon Anthony (3c), June 10

2: $20,000 Bear Chum (8g), June 24

WEEKLY HONORS #9 (July 15-18): Jockey Eddie Martinez Trainer Frank Lucarelli Owner Homer Thoroughbreds WTBOA WA Bred: Cobra Jet (Bred by Terry & Mary Lou Griffin).

NOTES: Leslie Mawing, No. 4 all-time with 761 wins at Emerald Downs, is named to ride three horses here this week. Mawing has been riding at Canterbury Park but rode here the tail end of last season and won on 17 of 86 mounts. . .Three-time Emerald Downs riding champion Rocco Bowen is currently tied for fourth with 21 wins at Arlington Park. . .John Lindley, longtime publisher of Parker’s tip sheet at Emerald Downs, enjoyed a great weekend of racing. Lindley and co-owner Ray Morton won a $20,350 maiden special weight with Temple Secret at Emerald Downs and finished second with Majestic Eagle in the $85,000 Wickerr Stakes on turf at Del Mar. . .Don’t look now but two-time defending training champion Frank Lucarelli suddenly is contending for another title. Just 3 for 51 on July 3, Lucarelli has won with nine of his last 26 starters and has zoomed into a second-place tie with Vince Gibson at 12 wins apiece, four back of Joe Toye.

-##-
